alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 3:30PM MST until March 15 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt. * WHERE...Dry Beaver Creek, in central Arizona. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Further rises in the water levels of already flooded creeks and normally dry washes. Deadly flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM MST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to light to moderate rain and melting snow. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Kimberlys Way is likely impassable, or will be soon. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dry Beaver Creek, Rattlesnake Canyon, Beaver Creek and Jacks Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mcguireville and Montezuma Castle National Monument. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
